item.title: China Launches Sea and Air Drills Around Taiwan
item.description: Military exercises come days after speech from Taiwan’s president reaffirming the island’s sovereignty.

item.title: Hezbollah Drone Strike Kills 4 Israeli Soldiers, Injures Dozens
item.description: A drone launched by Hezbollah passed through Israel’s air-defense systems and hit an Israeli military base near Binyamina in central Israel.

item.title: Ukraine Faces Bleak Winter as Russia Ramps Up Assaults, U.S. Support Trickles In
item.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky is pleading for more arms and other assistance to help end the war on favorable terms, but the Biden administration is skeptical.

item.title: China Keeps World Guessing on Size of Fiscal Stimulus
item.description: Beijing’s finance minister laid out spending plans but left investors hanging on the scale and scope of economic rescue efforts.

item.title: Worldwide Efforts to Reverse the Baby Shortage Are Falling Flat
item.description: Subsidized minivans, no income taxes: Countries have rolled out a range of benefits to encourage bigger families, with no luck.

item.title: U.S. Is Sending Antimissile System to Israel to Bolster Defenses Against Iran
item.description: The move comes as U.S. and Israel are holding talks on a possible Israeli attack on Iran.

item.title: Hezbollah Tunnel Entrances Abut U.N. Peacekeeping Position, Israel Alleges
item.description: The Israeli military took reporters into Lebanon to see tunnel shafts that it said were among hundreds of tunnel entrances and underground bunkers used by Hezbollah.

item.title: A Port Deal Unsettles U.S. Counterterror Fight in the Horn of Africa
item.description: The pact between Ethiopia and Somaliland has enraged Somalia, but could provide Ethiopia access to a naval base in the breakaway region.

item.title: Attacks on Gay Rights Push Russia's LGBTQ Community Into the Shadows
item.description: Moscow has accelerated its drive against sexual minorities over the past several months, leaving an entire generation of the LGBTQ community with a difficult choice.

item.title: Former Scottish First Minister Alex Salmond Dies at 69
item.description: The political leader championed Scottish independence from the U.K. for decades.

item.title: Israel Says Documents Found in Gaza Show Hamas's Attack Planning, Iran Ties
item.description: Letters and meeting minutes shared by Israel’s military appear to show Hamas seeking funding from Tehran and trying to win support from Hezbollah.

item.title: China Says It Has a Big Stimulus Coming---But Still Won't Say How Big
item.description: With few details offered by officials, stock investors are back to where they started the week: in a waiting game.

item.title: Four Ways Ukraine's Drone Innovations Are Changing Warfare
item.description: Aerial craft engineered to counter Russia’s battlefield advantages can intercept spy drones, plant mines and spew molten metal.

item.title: A Museum Overflowing With Prehistoric Treasures Races to Save Itself
item.description: The Nairobi National Museum is home to unusual specimens dating back millions of years, from a famed Homo erectus skeleton to giant crocodile skulls. Scientists worry the collection won’t last much longer.

item.title: U.S. Tightens Oil Sanctions on Iran as It Seeks to Contain Israeli Attack
item.description: The White House is trying to persuade Israel not to carry out military strikes against Iran’s oil infrastructure or nuclear sites.

item.title: Israeli Military Intensifies Campaign Against Hezbollah in Lebanon
item.description: Two peacekeepers were injured when explosions rocked the headquarters of the United Nations mission on the Lebanon-Israel border.

item.title: Scott Thorson, Liberace Lover and Key Witness in 'Wonderland Murders,' Dies at 65
item.description: After moving in with the entertainer as a teenager, he got hooked on celebrity and drugs, and spent much of his life chasing both.

item.title: Nobel Peace Prize Goes to Japanese Atomic-Bomb Survivors Group
item.description: Nihon Hidankyo, a grassroots group, was recognized for its efforts to rid the world of nuclear weapons.

item.title: China's Stimulus Barrage Draws Out Cautious House Hunters
item.description: State media reported a jump in home viewings and sales during a recent holiday period, but hesitancy remains among prospective buyers after a long real-estate slump.

item.title: Iran's Secret Warning to U.S. Allies: Don't Help Israel, or You're Next
item.description: The threats through diplomatic channels have prompted Arab states to tell the U.S. that they won’t aid any attack on Iran.
